ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned more about the US criminal justice system.

Presentation skills and leading discussion, policy research and evaluation. This course provides a great exploration of the politics of crime and punishment, covering topics like the war on crime, mass incarceration, and prosecutorial discretion.
I learned a LOT about crime and punishment in American cities. I learned how to critically evaluate various essays and scholarly works.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Weaknesses are that it focused too heavily on student presentations; could be improved by more engagement by the professor.
could be less presenting and more lectures

The readings and lectures were engaging. The final paper was really helpful in helping us think about what we learned in the course, apply this knowledge, and engage in policy research and evaluation. I preferred when Professor Harris lectured over the student presentations, but these presentations were helpful in preparing for the midterm and further understanding and analyzing the readings.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If in current format, no, given that since it was mostly students presenting, it is possible to have learned most of the material from self reading.
Yes, i think this course is very relevant and topical to the current situation of the world and i would highly recommend
Yes! Very important course topics and the final paper was a great academic experience.
Yes! Professor Harris is amazing, the readings were very interesting and I loved the course.
